intro: Gossampinus buonopozensis, commonly known as the Buonopozese cottonwood, is a rare and lesser-known species within the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its woody stems and broad, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds encased in a capsule, typical of the cottonwood genus. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity and adaptation.
